qas.question: When did Manhattan's no wave scene start becoming more dance-oriented?
What formula did a lot of the artists emerging from the scene adhere to?
What type of party could be found at venues like Club 57?
Who did the venues because cultural hubs for?
What movement was the group the Lounge Lizards indebted to?
What did Downtown Manhattan's no wave scene transition into?
What type of sound did no wave have before it began to transition to a more dance oriented sound?
When was ZE's Mutant Disco released?
What clubs were frequented by artists in the emerging dance scene?
When did the no wave scene decide not to transition?

plausible_answers.text: Jean-Michel Basquiat, Keith Haring and Michael Holman

qas.question: Who was rarely on the scene?

plausible_answers.text: Swans, Glenn Branca, the Lounge Lizards, Bush Tetras and Sonic Youth

qas.question: What groups were not influenced by no wave?

plausible_answers.text: Swans, Glenn Branca, the Lounge Lizards, Bush Tetras and Sonic Youth

context: <b9_0>In the <a0_0>early 1980s<b9_0/><a0_0/>, Downtown Manhattan's no wave scene transitioned from its <a6_0>abrasive<a6_0/> origins into a more <a5_0>dance-oriented sound<a5_0/>, with compilations such as ZE's Mutant Disco (<a7_0>1981<a7_0/>) highlighting a newly playful sensibility borne out of the city's clash of hip hop, disco and punk styles, as well as dub reggae and world music influences. Artists such as Liquid Liquid, the B-52s, Cristina, Arthur Russell, James White and the Blacks and Lizzy Mercier Descloux pursued a formula described by Luc Sante as <a1_0>"anything at all + disco bottom"<a1_0/>. The <a2_0>decadent<a2_0/> parties and art installations of venues such as <a8_0><b10_0>Club 57 and the Mudd Club<b10_0/><a8_0/> became cultural hubs for <a3_0>musicians and visual artists alike<a3_0/>, with figures such as <b11_0>Jean-Michel Basquiat, Keith Haring and Michael Holman<b11_0/> frequenting the scene. Other <a4_0>no wave<a4_0/>-indebted groups such as <b12_0><b13_0>Swans, Glenn Branca, the Lounge Lizards, Bush Tetras and Sonic Youth<b13_0/><b12_0/> instead continued exploring the early scene's forays into noise and more abrasive territory.
